page.title: 06Ashdown House, Hastings
page.content: The {Department of the Environment {Account }Section was moved from London to Hastings in 1966. The building is big and made of concrete and glass.It has lots of windows and it gets very hot in the summer.Many{different offices}are in the building.About 1500 work there, working out wages for all the British Isles. They use many{computers}to do this. These are kept in a special air conditioned building at even temperature. You have to have a pass to get into the building. Next to Ashdown House is a{club}called Civil Sevice Sports Club where members can buy drinks and talk.There is a games room with snooker,darts and pool.They hold disco dances there and private parties. The Ministry runs many{sports teams, including football and table tennis.
